name: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Date Caramel Snack Bars
description: These Vegan Date Caramel Bars are the best grab-and-go snack for all lovers of oatmeal bars, chocolate, and caramel. Easy & delicious oatmeal chocolate chip bars made completely from scratch in no time, layered with creamy homemade date caramel.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup flour (I use all-purpose flour, use gf blend or oat flour for Glutenfree )
1/3 cup chocolate chips or chocolate chunks
10-11  soft dates (soaked in hot water for 15 minutes)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, add the almond butter, maple syrup, vanilla, and oil. Heat the non-dairy milk until it's hot and then add to the bowl. Mix until all of these wet ingredients are well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, add the almond butter, maple syrup, vanilla, and oil. Heat the non-dairy milk until it's hot and then add to the bowl. Mix until all of these wet ingredients are well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the oats, flour, baking soda, salt, and chocolate chips and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the oats, flour, baking soda, salt, and chocolate chips and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a 8 by 8 inch pan or a similar baking dish with parchment paper and press this mixture into the baking pan. Even it out with a spatula. Put in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180C) for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a 8 by 8 inch pan or a similar baking dish with parchment paper and press this mixture into the baking pan. Even it out with a spatula. Put in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180C) for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, make your date caramel. Drain the dates and blend with almond butter, salt, and maple syrup. Add 2-3 tablespoons of milk initially and add more if needed. Blend until it's a smooth mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, make your date caramel. Drain the dates and blend with almond butter, salt, and maple syrup. Add 2-3 tablespoons of milk initially and add more if needed. Blend until it's a smooth mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the baking pan out of the oven and spread the date caramel all over. Even out with a spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the baking pan out of the oven and spread the date caramel all over. Even out with a spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Top it with the coconut and chocolate chips and put it back to bake for another 15-20  minutes or until the top is golden to preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Top it with the coconut and chocolate chips and put it back to bake for another 15-20  minutes or until the top is golden to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes before removing it from the pan and cool for another 10 minutes before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes before removing it from the pan and cool for another 10 minutes before slicing.

recipeInstructions.text: The bars will keep in the counter for a day and in the refrigerator for up to 10 days.
